revised_title: Electrochemical Protection of Metals in Marine Environments
tldr: The author, Humphry Davy, investigates the factors affecting the preservation of metals, particularly copper sheathing on ships, using electro-chemical means. He examines the influence of motion, distance, and imperfect conductors on the protective effect of metals. Davy also explores the importance of selecting pure copper, applying it smoothly, and using copper nails for attachment to ensure effective protection against corrosion and marine growth.
